comments.creator: jonathan_haas@live.de
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:8.0a1) Gecko/20110722 Firefox/8.0a1
Build ID: 20110722030827

Steps to reproduce:

Hover this link: http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=1+%2B+2


Actual results:

Status displays http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=1+++2 
which is ambiguous because you can't decide if a + is a plus or a space.


Expected results:

Status displays 
http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=1 + 2
or
http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=1+%2B+2

preferably the first.
comments.author: jonathan_haas@live.de
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:8.0a1) Gecko/20110722 Firefox/8.0a1
Build ID: 20110722030827

Steps to reproduce:

Hover this link: http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=1+%2B+2


Actual results:

Status displays http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=1+++2 
which is ambiguous because you can't decide if a + is a plus or a space.


Expected results:

Status displays 
http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=1 + 2
or
http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=1+%2B+2

preferably the first.

Someone knows which code to look at? In XULBrowserWindow.updateStatusField (browser.js) the url is already wrong, but I have no idea from where this code is called. (Call stack in venkman does not work).
comments.creator: jonathan_haas@live.de
comments.author: jonathan_haas@live.de
comments.text: Someone knows which code to look at? In XULBrowserWindow.updateStatusField (browser.js) the url is already wrong, but I have no idea from where this code is called. (Call stack in venkman does not work).

comments.raw_text:
Note that when hovering bookmarks or objects in the places library, the url is displayed correctly as http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=1+%2B+2

It probably would make sense, to clean up the code and have only one single function, which properly processes all urls in the same way for status bar display.
comments.author: jonathan_haas@live.de
comments.text:
Note that when hovering bookmarks or objects in the places library, the url is displayed correctly as http://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=1+%2B+2

It probably would make sense, to clean up the code and have only one single function, which properly processes all urls in the same way for status bar display.
comments.creator: jonathan_haas@live.de

comments.raw_text: This isn't a problem with URL parsing. Overlinks are set via (XULBrowserWindow::setOverLink)[https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/01b4b3830ea3cae2e9e431019afa6391b471c6da/browser/base/content/browser.js#4599] which ultimately calls textToSubURI.unEscapeURIForUI.
comments.text: This isn't a problem with URL parsing. Overlinks are set via (XULBrowserWindow::setOverLink)[https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/01b4b3830ea3cae2e9e431019afa6391b471c6da/browser/base/content/browser.js#4599] which ultimately calls textToSubURI.unEscapeURIForUI.
comments.author: valentin.gosu@gmail.com
